trap_list.name: Elasticity vs Scalability
trap_list.misconception: Treating elasticity and scalability as identical.
trap_list.fix: Scalability is the ability to increase capacity; elasticity is rapid (often automatic) up/down adjustment to demand.

trap_list.name: Block Storage vs Object Storage
trap_list.misconception: Using object storage as if it were a VM disk, or block storage as a web object store.
trap_list.fix: Block storage behaves like a disk volume for VMs/databases; object storage is API-based for unstructured data at scale.

trap_list.name: Security Group vs WAF vs CASB
trap_list.misconception: Thinking these controls do the same job because they all 'filter traffic'.
trap_list.fix: Security groups filter network flows to instances; WAF inspects web app requests; CASB governs access and data policies across cloud services.

trap_list.name: VM Escape vs Resource Reuse
trap_list.misconception: Confusing isolation breakouts (VM escape) with residual-data exposure (resource reuse).
trap_list.fix: VM escape breaks the VM boundary; resource reuse exposes leftover data when resources are reallocated without proper clearing/encryption.

trap_list.name: IaaS vs PaaS Responsibility
trap_list.misconception: Assuming the provider patches your guest OS in IaaS.
trap_list.fix: In IaaS, you patch the guest OS; in PaaS/SaaS, the provider manages more of the stack. Always map duties with the responsibility matrix.

missions.name: Cloud Fundamentals: Models, Roles, and Characteristics
missions.goal: Lock in cloud definitions, essential characteristics, service models, and deployment patterns.

coaching_tips: Cloud questions love subtle wording: 'scale up' vs 'scale out' vs 'elastic'.
Map every scenario to (1) service model, (2) deployment model, (3) who owns which responsibilities.

missions.name: Governance: Shared Responsibility, Vendors, and Data Sovereignty
missions.goal: Apply shared responsibility, contract/audit thinking, and location/jurisdiction constraints.

coaching_tips: If the question says 'IaaS', assume you patch the OS. If it says 'SaaS', assume the provider patches the app platform.
Look for contract language: audit rights, shared-responsibility clarity, and data location.

missions.name: Cloud + Virtualization Security Controls
missions.goal: Recognize virtualization risks and pick the right cloud control (CASB/WAF/security groups/storage/IaC/secrets).

coaching_tips: Security groups control network flows; WAF inspects web app traffic; CASB governs cloud service usage.
Resource reuse + VM escape are the virtualization gotchas—think isolation and cleanup.
